intro: Physaria pruinosa, commonly known as the pruinose bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, round seed pods that are often covered in a whitish, powdery coating. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Physaria pruinosa is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants.
